controller

Class CalendarController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • controller.CalendarController

  • public class CalendarController
extends java.util.Observable
    This is the Controller aspect of our MVC architecture for our Calendar. This class uses the various other classes within the model and bridges the view and model to create functionality for the calendar. This class requires access to Year.java, Event.java, Month.java, Week.java, Day.java, and CalendarView.java.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CalendarController(int currYear)
      The constructor for the controller, taking in an int representing the current year

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalendarController

        public CalendarController(int currYear)
        The constructor for the controller, taking in an int representing the current year
        Parameters:
        currYear - This method takes in the current year of the calendar as well as the view (which will be an Observer) and creates the Calendar with the various important fields of the controller. The method creates a HashMap of years (which are the different Calendars) as well as creating a save file for the calendar's save state. The constructor sets all of these things and then sets the view as an observer.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save()
        This method "saves" the state of the Calendar by writing to the save file that the controller contains. The method creates a save file with the controller's saveName and deletes the previous save file before creating the new one to replace it.

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(model.Day day,
                        java.lang.String label,
                        int sH,
                        int sM,
                        int eH,
                        int eM,
                        java.lang.String notes,
                        java.lang.String loc,
                        java.lang.String color)
        Adds an event to the given day object
        Parameters:
        day - The object to add the event to
        label - The label of the event
        sH - The starting hour of the event
        sM - The starting minute of the event
        eH - The end hour of the event
        eM - The end minute of the minute
        notes - The notes of the event (can be null)
        loc - The location of the event (can be null)
        color - The string representation of the color for color coding
        Returns:
        a boolean value of if the attempt to add was successful This method takes in all of the necessary fields for the event to add to the inputted day, and it creates an event (which has an Observer, the controller's view object). If the event is able to be added (if the label isn't empty), true is returned.

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        This method returns the current year
        Returns:
        int The calendar's current year This method simply returns the current year as an integer.

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(model.Day day,
                        model.Event event)
        This method removes the first instance of the event with the passed in label within the events list of the day
        Parameters:
        day - The day to remove an event from
        event - the Event to remove from the specified day This method takes in an event object and removes the given event from the list of events. The Day is then set as changed and observers are notified (note, the event is found by comparing event labels).

      • changeYear

        public void changeYear(int year)
        This method takes in a year and changes the current year of the calendar to the inputed year
        Parameters:
        year - The year to put in as the new current year This method takes in the integer year and if the year is not in the year map, it is added and the current year is set to it. If it is in the map, it is simply set as the current year.

      • getDays

        public model.Day[] getDays(java.lang.String monthName)
        Takes in a year and a month and returns the array of Day objects for that month
        Parameters:
        monthName - The month to grab the days of
        Returns:
        Day[] the array of days for that month This method takes in a String monthName and returns the current year's Day array for the given month.
